title: 114_hr3055
content: The Act titled "Cuba Digital and Telecommunications Advancement Act of 2015" or "Cuba DATA Act" allows for the exportation of consumer communication devices and telecommunications services to Cuba. The President may authorize the export of communication devices and telecommunications services to Cuba, establish facilities for telecommunications services, conduct related transactions, and enter into contracts with individuals or entities in Cuba under the "Cuba Digital and Telecommunications Advancement Act of 2015". The President is required to submit a report on the access to the Internet in Cuba and the infrastructure needed to increase access to 50 percent by 2020. The report also includes information on accessing data through cell phones in Cuba and the infrastructure required to expand this capability to rural and urban areas. The curr_chunk discusses the impact of access to telecommunications technology on new businesses, co-ops, and educational opportunities in Cuba, as well as how telecommunications equipment and services are advancing human rights objectives. Definitions for consumer communication devices and persons subject to US jurisdiction are also provided. The term "person subject to the jurisdiction of the United States" includes individuals, entities, and organizations within the US or owned/controlled by US citizens. "Telecommunications services" encompass data, telephone, telegraph, and Internet services. Telecommunications services include data, telephone, telegraph, Internet connectivity, radio, television, news wire feeds, and services related to consumer communication devices and equipment. This also encompasses services incident to Internet communications and domain name registration. SEC. 3. REPEAL OF CERTAIN AUTHORITIES PREVENTING FINANCING AND MARKET REFORM FOR CUBA. The Cuban Democracy Act of 1992 is repealed, and amendments are made to the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity Act of 1996. Sections of the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity Act are also mentioned for amendment. The Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity Act of 1996 is repealed, with a conforming amendment made to section 109(a) of the Act.
